title: Castle Rackrent - few who read history "derive..."

content.prompt: In the context of the passage, the reason that few who read history “derive any advantage from their labors” (second sentence) is that

choices.label: the common reader is unable to appreciate what he or she reads
the historian’s preoccupation with facts makes for dull reading
the focus of history on the distant past is too remote for most readers
the historian tends to present historical figures unrealistically

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and explain claims and evidence within an argument.
